title: Wawa is going, like, totally ’80s with ‘The Goldbergs’
body: Barry Goldberg reppin' the Jenkintown Posse at his local Wawa in "The Goldbergs." The convenience store chain is embracing a "Goldbergs" theme for Wawa Week.Tease that hair and get out those leg warmers because  stores are being transported to the 1980s.Not just any ’80s — “” ’80s.The convenience store is a regular presence in the ABC comedy series, which is set in Jenkintown, Pennsylvania in the decade of Teddy Ruxpin, Cabbage Patch Kids, the Brat Pack and “Alf.”In celebration of Wawa Week, marking the 57th anniversary of Wawa’s entry to the retail business, the chain is running a “Goldbergs” promotion. The real-life Wawa in Jenkintown is getting an ’80s makeover, while Wawas in New Jersey and across the country are celebrating like it’s 1980-something.The cast of "The Goldbergs."Wawa Week begins Friday, April 16. Wawa opened its first convenience store in Folsom, Pennsylvania April 16, 1964.Through April 23, Wawa stores will have ’80s music, video clips from “The Goldbergs” and fuel pumps decorated with scenes from the show. Customers can enter to win “Goldbergs” swag at .There’s also a charitable component: a portion of proceeds from cups of coffee bought on April 16 and “The Goldbergs” Garlic Cheesy Chicken Parm Hoagie purchased during Wawa Week will benefit Children’s Miracle Network hospitals up to $100,000.Note to readers: if you purchase something through one of our affiliate links we may earn a commission.
